title: Rural Clearbrook Man Arrested in Shooting of Sheriff's Deputy in NW Minnesota
content:
Carstie Clausen of rural Clearbrook was arrested
A Polk County sheriff's deputy was shot Monday morning near the northwestern Minnesota town of Fosston.
According to the Clearwater County Sheriff's Office, the deputy was shot in the arm while in a U.S. Customs and Border Protection helicopter at the Fosston Municipal Airport.
The sheriff's office stated the helicopter was in the area of suspected drug activity near the Polk-Clearwater county line.
Investigators say the helicopter was shot at least two times by a high-powered rifle. Deputies say they arrested Carstie Clausen of rural Clearbrook, Minnesota, in the woods near a small cabin. Clausen is being held on suspicion of assault.
